headline: Tracking the tracker in gigawatt-scale
summary_80w: Statkraft and 3E analysed 64 utility-scale PV plants, representing 2.1GWp DC capacity, with datasets spanning six months to five years.

headline: ‘Each megawatt will be competing’: Wärtsilä on Australia’s evolving grid-scale BESS market
summary_80w: “Australia remains a multi-gigawatt proving ground for utility-scale energy storage systems,” says Kashish Shah of Wärtsilä Energy Storage.

headline: SolarPower Europe’s new hybrid solar + BESS due diligence reports seek to ensure ‘long-term technical excellence’
summary_80w: SolarPower Europe has released two new technical due diligence reports for utility-scale hybrid solar PV and battery energy storage system (BESS) projects.

headline: SolarEdge reduces net loss in 2025 as revenue increases to US$1.1 billion
summary_80w: Israel-headquartered inverter producer SolarEdge has reported revenue of US$1.1 billion in 2025, while reducing its net loss from the previous year.

headline: NexWafe, Talon PV ink 7GW wafer supply agreement in the US
summary_80w: German solar wafer manufacturer NexWafe and US-based cell producer Talon PV have signed a wafer supply agreement in the US.

headline: ‘Think about this in terms of portfolios’: how Europe’s solar investment landscape has shifted towards big-picture thinking
summary_80w: Making investment decisions based on an entire renewable energy portfolio, rather than the merits of an individual project, is now the norm.

headline: Swift Current Energy secures US$248 million for 122MW Maine solar project
summary_80w: Swift Current Energy has secured tax equity financing and US$248 million in project financing for its 122MW Three Rivers Solar facility.

headline: Without transparent energy planning, the lights could go out
summary_80w: A team from Open Energy Transition discusses the benefits of open energy system modelling in assessing resources, including energy storage of varying durations.

headline: US Roundup: California CCAs secure LDES from Hydrostor, ESS Inc. iron-salt acquisition, PowerSecure microgrids enhance New Mexico grid
summary_80w: In this US news roundup, CC Power signs an agreement with Hydrostor for 400MWh of its Willow Rock LDES project, PowerSecure builds microgrids in New Mexico, and ESS Inc acquires VoltStorage.

headline: Moonwatt targets ‘same disruption string inverters had in solar’ with distributed sodium-ion BESS architecture
summary_80w: We hear from Netherlands-based 'distributed hybridisation' sodium-ion BESS startup Moonwatt, as it announces its first project 18 months after being founded and around a year after executives introduced its tech and strategy to Energy-Storage.news.

headline: The Energy Storage Report 2026 out now: grid-forming, fire safety, bankability and more
summary_80w: The 2026 edition of The Energy Storage Report is out now and available to download, charting the key trends, challenges and successes in the industry.

headline: Ukraine’s strategic need for energy storage
summary_80w: Ukraine's government sees energy storage as a tool of strategic national importance as the country weathers Russian attacks and looks to the future.

headline: Australia’s NSW directs ASL to deliver firming tender for 2033-34 capacity shortfall
summary_80w: New South Wales (NSW) energy minister Penny Sharpe has directed ASL to deliver a firming capacity tender addressing forecast energy shortfalls from 2033-34.

headline: Gigawatt-hours of investments, tolls, optimisation and platform financing across Europe this week
summary_80w: Another roundup of European BESS news, but this time around portfolios, partnerships, investments, financing, optimisation and tolling in France, Spain, Belgium, Denmark, Finland and Romania. Notable highlights are Grenergy's 10-year BESS toll in Spain and Ingrid Capacity entering the French market.

headline: Meralco energises Phase 1 of 3.5GW MTerra solar-plus-storage project in the Philippines
summary_80w: Meralco PowerGen Corporation has completed initial grid synchronisation and energisation of the 3.5GW MTerra solar project, which includes a 4.5GWh battery energy storage system (BESS).

headline: Octopus acquires California solar-plus-storage project as part of US$1 billion investment
summary_80w: Octopus Energy has announced an investment of 'nearly' US$1 billion into Californian clean energy, including a solar-plus-storage project.

headline: Solar needs ‘high-resolution data’ to manage weather and grid curtailments, says expert
summary_80w: Data collection and analysis in solar PV installations is increasingly sophisticated, particularly relating to grid interaction and weather forecasting.

headline: Utility-scale solar and wind curtailment exceeds 7TWh in NEM in 2025
summary_80w: Utility-scale solar and wind curtailment in Australia’s NEM reached a record high of over 7TWh in 2025, according to analyst Rystad Energy.

headline: UL Solutions releases cybersecurity certification programme for PV inverters
summary_80w: Testing and Certification company UL Solutions has launched a new cybersecurity certification programme for distributed energy resources (DER) and inverters.

headline: How can AI enhance solar and storage synergy to tackle the duck curve?
summary_80w: 'Advanced forecasting tools are already improving solar and demand predictions by over 30%,' writes Schneider Electric's Frédéric Godemel.

headline: ‘No way around’ AI for European solar
summary_80w: There is ‘no way around AI’ for solar companies or Europe’s solar industry as a whole, according to Walburga Hemetsberger, CEO of SolarPower Europe.

headline: Lydian Energy secures US$689 million for three US BESS and solar projects
summary_80w: IPP Lydian Energy has secured US$689 million in financing for two solar projects and a battery energy storage system (BESS) project in New Mexico, Texas, and Utah, US.

headline: Interim FEOC guidance from US Treasury refers back to existing safe harbour guidelines
summary_80w: The US Treasury’s interim FEOC guidance has outlined “Material Assistance” provisions, which rely heavily on existing safe harbour calculations.

headline: Slow start to global 2026 BESS deployments in January, China continues to dominate
summary_80w: The first monthly global grid-scale BESS deployment figures for 2026 are in from Rho Motion, showing a year-on-year fall and China continuing to account for the majority of activity.

headline: Battery storage can help establish a new era of European energy resilience
summary_80w: More needs to be done to cement energy storage's vital role in European energy resilience, writes Teresa Casacchia, head of storage at Baywa r.e.

headline: New Zealand gentailer Contact Energy eyes US$316 million raise for renewables and energy storage expansion
summary_80w: Contact Energy plans to raise NZ$525 million (US$316 million) in equity funding to fast-track its Contact31+ strategy for its renewable energy and storage pipeline in New Zealand.

headline: Quinbrook powers up 619MWh Supernode Stage One BESS in Queensland, Australia
summary_80w: Quinbrook Infrastructure Partners has commenced commercial operations for the 619MWh Stage One of its Supernode battery energy storage system (BESS) project, located at the South Pine substation in Queensland, Australia.

headline: Australia commissions 4.9GWh of grid-scale batteries in 2025, matching entire 2017-2024 output
summary_80w: Australia’s Clean Energy Council has said that 2025 saw as many battery energy storage systems commissioned as in the last 8 years combined.

headline: Caterpillar VC backs startup ElevenEs as it builds 1GWh LFP cell factory in Serbia
summary_80w: The venture capital (VC) arm of Caterpillar has invested in ElevenEs, a startup building a gigawatt-hour-scale lithium iron phosphate (LFP) cell factory in Europe.

headline: ACEN Australia integrates 400MW Stubbo solar PV plant into AU$750 million financing pool
summary_80w: ACEN Australia has announced the integration of its 400MW Stubbo Solar project in New South Wales into its AU$750 million (US$530 million) non-recourse portfolio debt facility.

headline: Lyra Energy secures PPAs for 255MW Thakadu solar project in South Africa
summary_80w: Lyra Energy has signed PPAs with three commercial and industrial offtakers covering a significant share of its 255MW solar PV project in Thakadu, South Africa.

headline: Nextpower signs three-year deal to provide Jinko Solar with US-made steel module frames
summary_80w: US solar equipment provider Nextpower has signed a three-year deal to supply Jinko Solar with solar PV module frames, made in the US.

headline: Fraunhofer ISE achieves two efficiency records for III-V tandem PV modules
summary_80w: Researchers at Germany’s Fraunhofer Institute for Solar Energy have claimed two new record efficiencies in tandem PV modules.

headline: Intertek bolsters PV inspection capabilities with Aerial PV acquisition
summary_80w: Quality assurance provider Intertek has acquired Aerial PV Inspection, a specialist in drone-enabled solar site inspections.

headline: Jupiter International commissions 1GW PERC cell line at Himachal facility
summary_80w: Jupiter International has commissioned its 1GW third solar cell production line online at its Baddi facility in Himachal Pradesh.

headline: Fixed-tilt and bifacial PV modules best positioned for Arctic deployment, says IEA
summary_80w: Fixed-tilt trackers and bifacial modules installed vertically could be the most effective way of deploying PV systems in Arctic environments.

headline: Sungrow and Huawei achieve AAA rating in new PV InverterTech bankability report
summary_80w: Chinese manufacturers dominate PV Tech Research’s new inverter bankability rating report, but recent EU and US policies targeting Chinese-made inverters may create opportunities for other companies.

headline: Contact Energy seeks US$316 million equity raise to lead New Zealand’s renewable energy transition
summary_80w: New Zealand gentailer Contact Energy has announced a NZ$525 million (US$316 million) equity raise to accelerate its Contact31+ strategy, which aims to position the company as a leader in New Zealand’s renewable energy future.

headline: Base Power partners with El Paso Electric, Sonnen launches ‘battery-only’ Texas VPP programme
summary_80w: Residential energy storage startup Base Power and utility El Paso Electric Company (EPE) have announced a new residential distributed energy resource (DER) pilot programme in Texas, US.

headline: KNESS and Hithium enter 2GWh Ukraine partnership, c.700MWh progressed elsewhere in Finland, Estonia and Southeast Europe
summary_80w: A busy week of large-scale BESS projects news from the Eastern side of Europe, with projects reaching commissioning, final investment decision, technology procurement and acquisition, led by KNESS' 2GWh partnership with Hithium in Ukraine.

headline: ‘Greater diversity reshapes expectations’: Women in Energy Storage Network on strengthening and empowering an inclusive industry
summary_80w: Women in Energy Storage Network (WinES) discusses how the organisation fosters collaboration and leadership, as it works to create an inclusive industry community.

headline: Australian Vanadium, Sumitomo Electric partner for bid in Western Australia’s 500MWh flow battery procurement
summary_80w: Australian Vanadium Limited has secured an exclusive partnership with Sumitomo Electric Industries for the 500MWh Kalgoorlie vanadium BESS.

headline: Queensland’s Stanwell opens 600MWh battery storage system in Australia
summary_80w: State-owned energy company Stanwell Corporation has commenced commercial operations of its 300MW/600MWh Tarong battery energy storage system (BESS) in Queensland.

headline: Axis Energy, GRIDCO partner to develop 5GW of renewables projects in Odisha
summary_80w: Axis Energy has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Government of Odisha to develop up to 5GW of renewable energy capacity in the state.

headline: From standalone to storage: how Australia’s utility-scale solar sector embraced the hybrid imperative
summary_80w: As Australia’s renewable sector matures, the coupling of solar and storage is emerging as the dominant paradigm for large-scale projects.

headline: Evecon, Mirova launch Estonia’s largest solar-storage hybrid, ink flexibility and power purchase agreement
summary_80w: A 77.5MW PV plant in Estonia is to be coupled with a 55MW/250MWh battery energy storage system to create what is claimed will be the country’s largest hybrid project.

headline: EIB backs 190MW Romanian PV projects with US$40 million investment
summary_80w: EIB is investing US$40 million to construct and operate three PV plants in southwestern Romania, with a combined capacity of 190MW.

headline: Enfinity Global expands bond facility to US$183 million to support US solar and storage deployment
summary_80w: Enfinity has expanded a bond facility with the Eiffel Investment Group to US$183 million, to further its work in US solar and BESS.

headline: Philippines government auctions to offer 25GW of renewable energy capacity a year until 2035
summary_80w: The Philippines will launch a number of renewable energy auctions between 2027 and 2035 for at least 25GW of capacity each year.

headline: France reduces solar PV target to 48GW by 2030 in new energy roadmap
summary_80w: The French government has published its latest energy roadmap for the coming years, setting a reduced target of 48GW for solar PV by 2030.

headline: NeoVolta raises US$23 million for Georgia battery pack and BESS manufacturing facility
summary_80w: NeoVolta has raised approximately US$23 million to support its 2GWh BESS manufacturing JV in Georgia, US.

headline: Plus Power brings ‘largest BESS on ISO New England grid’ online, in Maine
summary_80w: Developer-operator Plus Power is now operating its 175MW/350MWh Cross Town Energy Storage facility in Gorham, Maine, US.

headline: Planning barriers ‘threaten to stall momentum’ in UK battery storage market
summary_80w: The UK just saw its biggest year of grid-scale battery storage deployments, but planning barriers “threaten to stall momentum,” according to one expert.

headline: Vietnam’s BESS breakthrough: A turning point for energy storage across ASEAN
summary_80w: Vietnam is confronting barriers to energy storage deployment, setting an example for the wider ASEAN region, writes Sunita Dubey.

headline: Fox ESS partners with Origin to expand VPP access across Australia
summary_80w: Fox ESS and Origin Energy have partnered to enable home battery storage systems to participate in Origin's Loop VPP programme in Australia.

headline: Inox Clean Energy, RJ Corp acquire Skypower Services, targeting 570MW of African solar PV capacity
summary_80w: Inox Clean Energy has partnered with integrated renewable energy platform RJ Corp to expand into Africa’s renewable energy markets.

headline: India’s 2026-27 budget backs solar supply chain growth, but execution remains key
summary_80w: PV Talk: Charith Konda, energy specialist at IEEFA, says India’s 2026-27 budget aims to “establish a stronger supply chain within the solar and PV cell and module sector,” but warns that “execution is as important as the policy itself.”

headline: Germany contracts 2.4GW of ground-mount solar capacity in 2X oversubscribed auction
summary_80w: Germany’s federal network agency (Bundesnetzagentur) has announced the results of its latest ground-mount solar auction, which closed with bids for more than twice as much capacity as was tendered.

headline: AES Indiana began operations at 250MW solar-plus-storage plant
summary_80w: AES Indiana, a subsidiary of US utility AES Corporation, has started commercial operations at a 250MW solar-plus-storage plant in Pike County, Indiana, US.

headline: US Treasury’s first interim FEOC guidance met with some relief
summary_80w: The US Treasury’s interim Foreign Entity of Concern (FEOC) guidance is “in line with expectations” according to a US renewable energy supply analyst.

headline: India solar PV additions reach 36.6GW, up 43% YoY – Mercom
summary_80w: Solar PV installations in India have reached a record 36.6GW in 2025, a 43% increase from the previous year’s 25GW.

headline: Belectric to deliver 210MW of solar PV capacity for Severn Trent Green Power in the UK
summary_80w: Belectric, a subsidiary of European energy company the Elevion Group, will deliver EPC services for a 210MW solar PV portfolio in the UK.

headline: ‘Beyond a lithium-only future’: How US trade rules could accelerate BESS diversification
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium hears from Giovanni Damato, President of organic flow battery company CMBlu Energy, Inc., on changes to FEOC and Section 301 tariffs.

headline: EnergyAustralia reaches financial close on 250MWh BESS in South Australia
summary_80w: Major Australian energy generator-retailer EnergyAustralia has reached financial close on its 250MWh Hallett battery energy storage system (BESS) in South Australia.

headline: CleanCo opens 500MWh Tesla Megapack BESS in Queensland, Australia
summary_80w: CleanCo Queensland has officially opened the Swanbank BESS, a 250MW/500MWh facility in Ipswich, Australia.

headline: Baltic BESS and TES: Estonia’s 1.1GWh district heating accumulator, Nidec PCS-transformer deal in Lithuania
summary_80w: A 582MWh battery storage project and a gigawatt-hour-scale thermal energy storage system are the latest big developments in the emerging Baltic region, north-eastern Europe.

headline: Grenergy secures financing for 400MW/1.4GWh Central Oasis solar-plus-storage platform in Chile
summary_80w: Spanish independent power producer Grenergy has closed a US$355 million senior non-recourse financing agreement for its Central Oasis solar-plus-storage platform in Chile.

headline: Greenbacker raises US$440 million for 674MW Cider solar project
summary_80w: Greenbacker has raised US$440 million in finance to support the development of the 674MW Cider solar project in the US state of New York.

headline: Malaysia’s largest standalone floating PV project begins construction
summary_80w: Developer EDRA Global Energy, a subsidiary of CGN, has started construction on a 300MW floating PV (FPV) project in Malaysia.

headline: SOLV Energy issues Nasdaq IPO
summary_80w: US solar EPC SOLV Energy has issued its initial public offering (IPO) on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, priced at US$25 per share.

headline: Optimism in European solar rebounds to highest levels seen since May 2025
summary_80w: European solar PV module and component buyers’ sentiment improved significantly in January 2026, according to sun.store's pv.index report.

headline: ‘The cost declines in lithium-ion tech provide very attractive pricing’: ASL on NSW’s recent 12GWh LDES tender
summary_80w: Thimo Mueller of ASL discusses the recent 12GWh LDES tender in New South Wales, Australia, with ESN Premium.

headline: Potentia achieves financial close for ‘Canada’s largest BESS’
summary_80w: Potentia Renewables has successfully closed financing for the Skyview 2 battery energy storage system (BESS) in Edwardsburgh Cardinal, Ontario, Canada.

headline: Yuma County, Arizona: BrightNight breaks ground on 1,200MWh solar-plus-storage project, LRE’s 450MWh BESS now operational
summary_80w: Two BESS projects in Yuma County, Arizona, one from BrightNight, and one from Leeward Renewable Energy, have reached significant milestones.

headline: Hanwha and Morrison’s Chrysalis partner for 3.5GW of solar and storage in North America
summary_80w: A US$30 billion infrastructure giant has just backed a partnership to bring 3.5GW of solar and energy storage to North America.

headline: LG Energy Solution Vertech ‘to deliver 50GWh of US BESS projects in 2026,’ signs Qcells EPC deal
summary_80w: LG ES Vertech, the US-based system integrator subsidiary of LG Energy Solution (LG ES), plans to deliver 50GWh of projects this year, ESN Premium has heard.

headline: Tesla set to launch vehicle-to-grid programme in the US
summary_80w: Tesla is set to officially launch its first vehicle-to-grid (V2G) programme in Texas, US, soon with eyes to expand into California.

headline: MENA poised to become global solar hub, says WoodMac analyst
summary_80w: PV Talk: Wood Mackenzie’s Yana Hryshko argues that MENA is emerging as a solar manufacturing hub, driven, in part, by Chinese partnerships.

headline: National Laboratory of the Rockies lays off 130 employees
summary_80w: The National Laboratory of the Rockies (NLR), previously known as the National Renewable Energy Lab, has laid off 134 employees.

headline: China to add 180-240GW of new solar PV capacity in 2026, down from 315GW in 2025
summary_80w: China expects to add 180-240GW of new solar PV capacity in 2026, according to the latest figures from the CPIA.

headline: MNRE adds 3GW of solar cell capacity to ALMM List-II, reaching 26GW
summary_80w: India’s MNREA has released the fourth revision of its ALMM II for solar cells, increasing the total enlisted manufacturing capacity to 26GW.

headline: EUROPE ROUND-UP: METLEN signs offtake deal in Italy, European Energy to finance Danish solar-plus-storage, TSE acquires French PV projects
summary_80w: A round-up of a number of European project stories from this week, including METLEN, European Energy and TSE.

headline: UK awards 4.9GW solar PV in latest CfD round
summary_80w: The UK government's Allocation round 7a (AR7a) of the Contracts for Difference (CfD) auction has awarded a record 4.9GW of solar PV.

headline: ‘Moment of truth’: The 2026 regulatory agenda for large battery storage in Germany
summary_80w: Germany's BESS market is booming but is still far behind what it is needed for its energy transition. 2026 will be a key year in this regard with several key regulatory questions potentially clarified, writes energy transition comms executive Frederik König.

headline: NineDot Energy closes US$431 million for New York BESS, Ameresco completes multiple tax credit transfers
summary_80w: Energy storage developer NineDot Energy closes US$431 million in construction financing for New York BESS projects. Meanwhile, US energy efficiency and renewables company Ameresco completes multiple tax credit transfer and financing transactions for solar PV and BESS.

headline: Ore Energy pilots 100-hour iron-air BESS at EDF lab in France
summary_80w: Netherlands-based iron-air long-duration energy storage (LDES) startup Ore Energy has completed a grid-connected pilot of its 100-hour iron-air LDES system at EDF Lab les Renardières in France.

headline: BESS financing benefitting from other clean energy segment struggles, US uncertainty, Fidra CEO says
summary_80w: Owner-operator Fidra Energy came out of virtually nowhere to be building one of Europe's largest BESS in the UK, the 1.4GW/3.1GWh Thorpe Marsh project. We catch up with CEO Chris Elder, about its strategy and projects but also broader BESS and clean energy financing trends.

headline: Akaysha Energy submits 1.6GWh BESS to Australia’s EPBC Act
summary_80w: Developer Akaysha Energy has submitted a 1.6GWh battery energy storage system (BESS) project to Australia's Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act.

headline: FinDev Canada commits US$56 million loan to 396MW Peruvian solar project, country’s largest
summary_80w: FinDev Canada has announced a US$56 million loan to support the development of project Illa, which will be the largest in Peru.

headline: Australia: Victoria government accelerates 700MW of battery storage via Development Facilitation Program
summary_80w: The Victoria government has approved two large-scale battery energy storage system (BESS) projects totalling 700MW through its Development Facilitation Program (DFP).

headline: Carlyle-backed Revera Energy bags US$150 million to accelerate renewables pipeline in the UK and Australia
summary_80w: Energy platform Revera Energy has completed an expanded US$150 million credit facility for its UK and Australian portfolio.

headline: ACME, Ceigall secure 220MW solar-plus-storage contracts in Madhya Pradesh
summary_80w: Rewa Ultra Mega Solar Limited (RUMSL) has extended a Letter of Award (LOA) to Ceigall India and ACME Solar to develop 220MW solar-plus-storage in Morena, Madhya Pradesh.

headline: Energy Vault to secure 1.5GWh of US-manufactured sodium-ion BESS from Peak Energy
summary_80w: Energy storage developer and system integrator Energy Vault and sodium-ion battery energy storage system (BESS) startup Peak Energy have announced a 1.5GWh strategic development agreement.

headline: Samsung SDI partners with Korea East-West Power to develop ‘global’ BESS projects
summary_80w: South Korean battery and electronics materials manufacturer Samsung SDI and South Korean state-utility Korea East-West Power (EWP) have signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to develop and invest in global energy storage systems (ESS) and renewable energy projects.

headline: RWE, Masdar, Zenobe, Enlight and others forge partnerships, tolling offers to further Germany market expansion
summary_80w: A busy week of grid-scale BESS project news from Germany, with numerous development, project, optimisation and tolling partnerships announced.

headline: Sungrow to invest US$270 million in inverter and BESS factory in Poland, first outside Asia
summary_80w: Chinese-based OEM Sungrow will build a PV inverter and battery storage manufacturing facility in southwest Poland, its first outside Asia.

headline: A123, Hithium tout semi-solid cells, immersion cooling and LSFT BESS safety advances
summary_80w: With battery storage safety under increasing scrutiny, Wanxiang A123 Systems and Hithium have unveiled new products and large-scale fire testing (LSFT), respectively.

headline: CATL, Cornex, SolaX and other Chinese energy storage players in multi-GWh international agreements
summary_80w: Carrie Xiao examines some notable recent partnerships and supply agreements for Chinese energy storage players in the Middle East, Europe, Africa and Australia.

headline: Revera Energy secures US$150 million to support 3.4GWh of battery storage across Australia and the UK
summary_80w: Energy infrastructure platform Revera Energy has completed an expanded US$150 million credit facility to accelerate development and construction of its battery storage, solar, and green hydrogen project pipeline across Australia and the UK.

headline: GridStor warns of industry slowdown as US Treasury guidance delays BESS decisions
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks to Daniel Dedrick, US-based BESS developer and operator, GridStor's CTO, about the company’s strategies for navigating FEOC and Section 301 tariffs.
